intro: Plectronia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly plectronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
